definition: to agree (to do sth)/should/ought to/must/(legal) shall
to answer/to respond/to comply with/to deal or cope with

sentences.english: B. They are very sweet, they must be in season.
sentences.chinese: 它们很甜，一定是应时的。

sentences.english: It is a cake steamed with the rice or rice flour with big stickiness, seasonable food for lunar calendar year.
sentences.chinese: 用黏性大的米或米粉蒸成的糕，是农历年的应时食品。

sentences.english: Partnering with OHRIA is a natural fit.
sentences.chinese: 与安大略赛马业协会合作是应时的举动？

sentences.english: I enjoy any fruit that's in season.
sentences.chinese: 我喜欢吃任何应时的水果。

sentences.english: The fresh, seasonal produce will be piled high and priced low.
sentences.chinese: 新鲜应时的产品堆积的很高，标价却很低廉。

definition: (idiom) to use methods appropriate to the current situation
timely/at the right moment/appropriate to the occasion/opportune/to fit current fashion
going with nature and the seasons (TCM)
to conform with destiny/as the occasion demands
to comply/to conform to/in tune with/adapting to/to adjust to
the four seasons, namely: spring 春, summer 夏, autumn 秋 and winter 冬
just at that time/as it happens/by good luck, just then
to push out the old and bring in the new (idiom); to innovate
